page.title: 07THE WOMEN'S INSTITUTE.
page.content: { The Women's Institute in Aston Ingham was formed in 1921 and plays a very important part in the life of the village. Because of the scattered nature of the cottages and farms and the narrow lanes to be negotiated, the meetings were held in the afternoons and this still holds good today. However because so many more women now go out to work this has caused a drop in numbers. Members not only enjoy their regular monthly meetings but also arrange additional craft sessions and outings and are generally involved in the catering for village functions, running stalls or are otherwise involved. Cliffords Mesne does not have a Women's Institute and those wishing to join either go to Aston Ingham or to Newent.
